title: US AI giants accuse Chinese rivals of mass data theft
snippet: US AI giants accuse Chinese rivals of mass data theft

title: Sam Altman says AI will ‘automate the whole economy’, shares message for students at IIT Delhi
snippet: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warned that AI will automate scientific progress and the economy. He advised students to stay up to date with AI tools and focus on understanding human needs and interactions, as these skills will remain valuable in an AI-driven future.

title: Samsung Galaxy Unpacked 2026: Launch date, live-stream details, and what to expect from the new Galaxy S26 lineup
snippet: Samsung Galaxy Unpacked 2026 on February 25 will showcase the S26 series with the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 processor. The event will also likely introduce Galaxy Buds 4 and Buds 4 Pro

title: Low-cost MacBook, iPhone 17e? Apple could launch 'at least' five products during 4 March event
snippet: Apple will hold its first event of 2024 on March 4 which could see the company revealing ‘at least’ five new products. The event will feature hands-on experiences in New York, London, and Shanghai while the company could unveil the products during a three day spree starting from 2 March.&nbsp;

title: Galaxy S26 Ultra leaks in full hands-on video: Live images, benchmark scores, and new Privacy Display revealed
snippet: Samsung's Galaxy S26 Ultra is set to launch soon. However, ahead of the launch, a user shared that he has purchased the phone in Dubai. The leak revealed the benchmark scores, privacy display, S pen and other features of the S26 Ultra.&nbsp;

title: Twin AI data leaks expose over a billion personal KYC records and private media files
snippet: Two major data leaks linked to AI apps have exposed sensitive information of millions globally. The first, from IDMerit, compromised 1 billion records, while the second, from the Video AI Art Generator app, leaked 8.27 million media files due to misconfigured cloud storage.

title: Robotaxis are coming to London. The citys famed black cab drivers are skeptical

title: Is advanced tech enough to boost HR services? Here's what study reveals amid push to digitise human resources
snippet: A study reveals that in retail, technology alone doesn't create value; it's the frontline employees who drive profitability. Tailored technology and strategic decisions informed by social context are essential for enhancing customer engagement and operational efficiency.

Pentagon summons Anthropic chief in dispute over AI limits
snippet: Amid intense pressure from the Trump administration, Pentagon officials have summoned the CEO of artificial intelligence company Anthropic to Washington for a meeting on Tuesday to discuss how its technology is used on classified systems.

title: YouTube exec says goal was viewer value not addiction
snippet: A landmark social media addiction trial resumed Monday with a YouTube executive insisting that the Google-owned company's aim was to give people value, not hook them on harmful binge-viewing. The trial is the first in a series of lawsuits filed by American families against social media platforms and

title: Apple to shift some Mac Mini production to Houston from Asia, WSJ reports
snippet: Apple will move some production of its ​Mac Mini desktop computer ​to the US from Asia, with a new manufacturing ​effort set to begin later this year at a Foxconn facility in north Houston, The Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

title: IBM posts steepest daily drop since 2000 after Anthropic says AI can modernise COBOL
snippet: Shares of International Business Machines recorded ​their steepest daily ​drop in more than 25 years ​on Monday, after AI startup Anthropic said its Claude Code tool could be used to modernize a ‌programming ⁠language run on ⁠IBM systems.

title: Anthropic kicks off share sale for staffers of up to $6 billion
snippet: Anthropic is offering some current and former employees the ability to sell shares in the company at a valuation of about $350 billion, according to people familiar with the matter — allowing them to cash in at the level of a recent $30 billion fundraising.

title: Amazon plans $12 billion Louisiana data center buildout
snippet: The Seattle-based online retailer said the data center buildout, in northwest Louisiana, will create 540 full-time jobs, as well as ‌additional jobs it ⁠claims ⁠will help support the facilities, such as electricians and heating, ventilation and air-conditioning technicians.

title: Food delivery growth revives; KreditBee eyes $1B valuation
snippet: Happy Tuesday! Food delivery majors registered strong growth in the December quarter. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: Canadian officials to meet with OpenAI safety team after school shooting
snippet: ​Canada summoned top officials from OpenAI for a meeting about the company's safety protocols, a Canadian official said on Monday, after the ChatGPT maker said it did not reach out to police about an account it banned last year belonging to mass ‌shooter Jesse Van ⁠Rootselaar.

title: Anthropic accuses three Chinese companies of harvesting its data
snippet: Anthropic said in a blog post Monday that DeepSeek, Moonshot and MiniMax -- three prominent Chinese startups -- used about 24,000 fraudulent accounts to generate more than 16 million conversations with its Claude chatbot that could be used to teach skills to their own chatbots.

title: China's DeepSeek trained AI model on Nvidia's best chip despite US ban, official says
snippet: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek's ​latest AI model, set to be ​released as soon as next week, was trained on Nvidia's most advanced AI chip, the Blackwell, a senior Trump ‌administration ⁠official said ⁠on Monday, in what could represent a violation of ​U.S. export controls.

title: Anthropic accuses Chinese AI labs of ‘distillation attacks’ on its models
snippet: US company says it identified actions by rivals DeepSeek, Moonshot and MiniMax

title: Measles cases are rising. Other vaccine-preventable infections could be next.
snippet: There’s a measles outbreak happening close to where I live. Since the start of this year, 34 cases have been confirmed in Enfield, a northern borough of London.
